title: Silent Stones
poem:
Silent stones, a whispered name,
Where shadows dance in flickering flame.
A tapestry of lives untold,
In earth's embrace, forever cold.

title: Graveyard Dusk
poem:
The sun descends, a crimson hue,
Across the graves, a somber view.
Whispering winds through ancient trees,
A graveyard's peace, a gentle breeze.

title: Forgotten Souls
poem:
Beneath the earth, forgotten souls,
Where time stands still, and silence rolls.
Inscribed in stone, their stories lie,
Beneath the vast and starlit sky.

title: Angels' Watch
poem:
Marble angels, wings unfurled,
Guardians of this sleeping world.
A solemn vigil, night and day,
Where memories softly fade away.

title: Mossy Tombs
poem:
Mossy tombs, a verdant shroud,
Where secrets sleep, and whispers crowd.
The ivy clings, a tender hold,
In stories etched, both new and old.

title: Echoes of Time
poem:
Echoes of time, in rustling leaves,
A symphony of sorrow weaves.
The graveyard's heart, a silent beat,
Where life and death forever meet.

title: Winter's Grave
poem:
Snowflakes fall, on frozen ground,
A winter's peace, profound and sound.
The graveyard sleeps, in icy grace,
A tranquil, timeless, hallowed place.

title: Moonlit Path
poem:
A moonlit path, through shadowed rows,
Where ghostly figures softly close.
The air is thick with whispered fears,
And echoes of forgotten years.

title: The Old Oak
poem:
An old oak stands, with gnarled embrace,
Witness to time, in this sacred space.
Its roots entwine, with buried deep,
A silent watch, while spirits sleep.

title: Stone Angels Cry
poem:
Stone angels cry, in silent pain,
As raindrops fall, like mournful rain.
Their tears descend, on hallowed ground,
Where peace and solace can be found.

title: The Watchman
poem:
The watchman walks, his lantern bright,
Guarding the graves, through darkest night.
A solemn duty, he must keep,
While souls find rest, in slumber deep.

title: Wildflowers Bloom
poem:
Wildflowers bloom, in vibrant hues,
Amidst the stones, where silence sues.
A gentle reminder, life's embrace,
In this serene and hallowed space.

title: Raven's Perch
poem:
A raven's perch, on weathered stone,
Observing all, both seed and bone.
Its watchful gaze, a silent keep,
Where secrets lie, in slumber deep.

title: Sunken Graves
poem:
Sunken graves, with tales untold,
Where memories fade, and hearts grow cold.
The earth conceals, what time has claimed,
In this quiet place, forever famed.

title: Wind's Lament
poem:
The wind's lament, a mournful sound,
As it sweeps across, the hallowed ground.
A symphony of sorrow's call,
In this graveyard's, silent thrall.

title: Whispering Pines
poem:
Whispering pines, a mournful sigh,
Beneath the gray and somber sky.
Their needles fall, like teardrops shed,
For those who rest, among the dead.

title: Eternal Rest
poem:
Eternal rest, the soul's release,
In this quiet haven, find sweet peace.
No earthly burdens, here remain,
Just tranquil slumber, free from pain.

title: Graveyard Gate
poem:
The graveyard gate, a solemn sight,
Where day gives way, to endless night.
A threshold crossed, to realms unseen,
Where spirits dwell, and shadows convene.

title: Broken Cross
poem:
A broken cross, with faded name,
A testament to life's fleeting flame.
Time's passage etched, in weathered stone,
A story whispered, all alone.

title: Graveyard Bloom
poem:
A single bloom, amidst the gray,
A touch of life, in this somber array.
A symbol of hope, in hearts that grieve,
That love and memory, will never leave.

title: Twilight's Embrace
poem:
Twilight's embrace, a gentle shroud,
As darkness falls, on this mournful crowd.
The graveyard sleeps, in hushed repose,
Where weary souls, find sweet repose.

title: Granite Tears
poem:
Granite tears, on weathered face,
A monument to time and space.
The sculptor's hand, a mournful art,
Reflecting sorrow, in every part.

title: Wailing Wall
poem:
A wailing wall, of grief and pain,
Where tears of sorrow, fall like rain.
Inscriptions carved, with loving hand,
A final tribute, to this sacred land.

title: Graveyard Green
poem:
Graveyard green, a vibrant hue,
Where life and death, forever renew.
A tapestry of growth and decay,
In this timeless, endless display.

title: Silent Bell
poem:
A silent bell, no longer tolls,
Its echoes lost, to weary souls.
A reminder of time's fleeting pace,
In this solemn, sacred space.

title: Epitaph's Tale
poem:
An epitaph's tale, in etched refrain,
A life's story, joy and pain.
Words of love, and memories kept,
While those who mourn, forever wept.

title: Graveyard's Keep
poem:
The graveyard's keep, a watchful eye,
Where spirits linger, 'neath the sky.
A guardian of secrets untold,
In this hallowed ground, forever bold.

title: Stone and Vine
poem:
Stone and vine, intertwined as one,
A symbol of life's, endless run.
Through death's embrace, new life takes hold,
A story whispered, brave and bold.

title: Graveyard's Call
poem:
The graveyard's call, a whispered plea,
To join the slumber, eternally.
A final resting place, serene and deep,
Where weary souls, forever sleep.

title: Shadowed Path
poem:
A shadowed path, through misty haze,
Where spirits wander, in a daze.
Their footsteps echo, soft and low,
In this realm of dreams, where memories flow.

title: Eternal Flame
poem:
An eternal flame, forever bright,
A beacon of hope, in darkest night.
Guiding lost souls, to their final rest,
In this hallowed ground, forever blessed.

title: Graveyard's Peace
poem:
The graveyard's peace, a tranquil scene,
Where worries cease, and hearts convene.
A place of solace, for those who grieve,
Where memories bloom, and souls believe.

title: Whispers of the Past
poem:
Whispers of the past, on every breeze,
Through rustling leaves, and ancient trees.
Stories unfold, in shades of gray,
In this graveyard's, timeless sway.

title: Graveyard's Heart
poem:
The graveyard's heart, a sacred ground,
Where life and death, forever bound.
A tapestry of stories told,
In this solemn place, forever bold.
